newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China tractor maker to offer 300-320 mln H shares.
newsitem.headline: China tractor maker to offer 300-320 mln H shares.

text.p: Henan-based No.1 Tractor Co Ltd plans to issue 300-320 million H shares in 1997, a company spokesman said on Monday.

The company, based in the city of Luoyang in central Henan province, expects to list the equity on the Hong Kong bourse in the first half of 1997, he told the Hong Kong-based China Securities Bulletin newsletter.
The firm is among 38 domestic enterprises newly selected by the Securities Commission of the State Council as candidates for overseas listing.
If the offer goes through, the company would use the proceeds to renovate production facilities and technology, the official said.
The company, which has total share capital of 480 million state shares, turned out 130,000 tractors in 1996, he said but did not give comparative figures.
The firm's results over the past few years will not be released to the pubic until an audit is completed, he said.
